Views

class News_app.views.ArticleViewSet(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

API ViewSet for managing Article objects, with custom actions for approval and publishing.

approve(request, pk=None)[source]

Approve an article (Editor only)

get_queryset()[source]

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

get_serializer_class()[source]

Return the appropriate serializer class based on the action.

my_articles(request)[source]

Get current user’s articles

pending_approval(request)[source]

Get articles pending approval (Editor only)

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
publish(request, pk=None)[source]

Publish an article

serializer_class

alias of ArticleSerializer

class News_app.views.CategoryViewSet(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

class News_app.views.CommentViewSet(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

API ViewSet for managing Comment objects.

get_queryset()[source]

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

perform_create(serializer)[source]
perform_destroy(instance)[source]

Delete a comment instance.

Only the author or an editor can delete a comment.

perform_update(serializer)[source]
permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
serializer_class

alias of CommentSerializer

get_queryset()[source]

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

class News_app.views.RegisterAPIView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: APIView

API endpoint for registering a new user. Accepts JSON data: username, password, email, first_name, last_name, role.

News_app.views.add_comment_view(request, article_id)[source]

Allow a user to add a comment to an article.

News_app.views.add_publisher_staff_view(request, publisher_id, role)[source]

Allow an admin to add staff (editor/journalist) to a publisher.

News_app.views.admin_home(request)[source]

Render the admin home page for superusers.

News_app.views.admin_publishers_view(request)[source]

Render the admin view for managing all publishers.

News_app.views.admin_users_view(request)[source]

Render the admin view for managing all users.

News_app.views.api_add_comment(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to add a comment to an article.

Accepts JSON: {“content”: <comment_content>}

News_app.views.api_list_subscriptions(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to list all publishers and journalists the current user is subscribed to.

Returns a list of publishers and journalists.

News_app.views.api_subscribable_users(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to get all publishers and journalists available to subscribe to.

Returns:

{ ‘publishers’: […], ‘journalists’: […] }

News_app.views.api_subscribe(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to subscribe the current user to a publisher or journalist. Accepts JSON: {“publisher”: <publisher_id>} or {“journalist”: <journalist_id>}

News_app.views.api_subscribed_content(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to list all newsletters and articles from authors and publishers that the current user is subscribed to.

Returns:

{ ‘articles’: […], ‘newsletters’: […] }

News_app.views.api_unsubscribe(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to unsubscribe the current user from a publisher or journalist.

Accepts JSON: {“publisher”: <publisher_id>} or {“journalist”: <journalist_id>}

News_app.views.approve_article_view(request, article_id)[source]

Allow an editor to approve an article.

Restrict access to users who can manage content (editors).

Return the display role string for a user (Admin or role display).

Render the home page with latest articles, categories, and stats.

News_app.views.notify_subscribers(obj, obj_type)[source]

Notify subscribers via email and Twitter when an article or newsletter is published.

News_app.views.paginate_queryset(request, queryset, per_page=10, page_param='page')[source]

Paginate a queryset for the given request and return the page object.

News_app.views.password_reset_api_view(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint to request a password reset. Accepts JSON data: {“email”: <user_email>} Sends a password reset link to the user’s email.

Render the list of articles and newsletters pending approval (for editors).
